info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 21 at 6:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Taos Avalanche Center. The Taos Avalanche Center in Taos has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch. * WHAT...The avalanche danger is currently considerable. A significant winter storm will continue to impact the northern mountains of New Mexico tonight into Wednesday and may increase the avalanche danger to High at all elevations Wednesday, March 22, 2023. * WHERE...Wheeler Peak Wilderness Area and Columbine Hondo Wilderness above 9000 feet. * WHEN... In effect through 7am MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...A significant winter storm remains on tap tonight through Wednesday, March 22nd where upwards of 2 to 3 feet of snow and strong winds could occur. Large dangerous natural and human triggered avalanches are likely through the day Wednesday. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Careful snowpack evaluation, cautious route finding and conservative decision-making are essential for travel in the backcountry through Wednesday. This Avalanche Watch is scheduled to expire at 7am on March 22nd. Check back with the Taos Avalanche Center to see if the Avalanche Watch is extended, or upgraded to an Avalanche Warning tomorrow morning. Consult http://www.taosavalanchecenter.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
